title: Gerald McKellar (rugby union)
text:
Gerald Forbes McKellar (2 March 1884 – 16 January 1960) was a New Zealand <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. A <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Wing">wing</a> and <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Back%20row">loose forward</a>, McKellar represented , , and at a provincial level. He was a member of the New Zealand national side, the <a href="All%20Blacks">All Blacks</a>, on their <a href="1910%20New%20Zealand%20rugby%20union%20tour%20of%20Australia">1910 tour of Australia</a>, playing in five matches, including all three internationals.
McKellar died at <a href="Dunedin">Dunedin</a> on 16 January 1960, and his ashes were buried at <a href="Andersons%20Bay%20Cemetery">Andersons Bay Cemetery</a>.
